RankDef.description: A new enlistee in the Imperial Legion, undergoing basic training and learning military discipline.
A basic infantry soldier of the Imperial Legion, trained in spear and shield combat formation.
A standard legionnaire, competent in all basic military skills and ready for campaign duty.
A legion member tasked with intelligence gathering, investigations, and special operations.
An elite warrior who has proven themselves in combat, the pinnacle of the standard legionary forces.
A newly commissioned knight of the Imperial Legion, beginning their journey in the knightly order.
An established knight who has proven their worth and earned a place among the Imperial knighthood.
A senior knight entrusted with protecting important Imperial interests and personnel.
A high-ranking knight who serves directly under the Dragon banner of the Empire, wielding considerable authority.
The highest rank of knighthood in the Imperial Legion, honored with the ancient Garland of victory.
A regional commander of Imperial Legion forces, responsible for major military operations and provincial defense.
The supreme leader of the entire Imperial Legion, answering only to the Emperor himself.
A militia member or support personnel working alongside the Imperial Legion, not a full legionnaire.
